name: Training week 1
plan:
This week we start our training for the Stockholm Marathon.

Start-up week in the four-hour program where we show a slightly tougher start with both short long runs directly and a distance run supplemented with some easy speed runs called coordination runs.

Because the program doesn't know how your training autumn looks like, the start can be a bit tough if it is the case that the start of the program is also the start of your running. If you feel that you have not practiced running before, start a little more calmly than indicated by running a little shorter on the Sunday session.

The basic speed of the program for easy distances is 5.40-5.50 min/km and is based on your goal of 4 hours. We simply run the distance almost at your marathon race pace.

But the pace is very individual, so your leisurely pace may not be at all on the program's leisurely distance pace of 5.40 min to 5.50 min per km, but it may be at 5.30 or 6.00 minutes per km so that the leisurely distance is calm and the running feels natural.

TAKE YOUR leisurely pace and start from it in the program and follow the km instructions, thus modifying the time to your time over the distance.

I hope the week is working well, and this feels like a fitting start to our 26 weeks together!

trainingDays.description:
This was an easy program with rest right away!!! 

No, we will train as well, but since the program has Tuesday/Thursday/Sunday as the main training days, we will rest today. In fact it is rest that is an important element in all training plans.

Rest builds up between all the training sessions, but to build up we of course need to train as well.

But today your training task will just be to mentally set yourself up for to actual training for the marathon; and tomorrow we start the training itself!!

The program's first training day will be an easy distance run. We are aiming for 6km, at your leisurely distance pace. Run as it feels natural to you, if it's 33 or 36 minutes, that's fine. However, the program specifies 34-35 minutes as a guideline, but thus nothing that you absolutely have to keep. Run so that you could talk throughout the round then you have the right level! After the run, you stretch out the running muscles. Just as good to introduce the stretch as a routine right from the start of training!â€‹

Calm distance that builds the foundation, but then we also supplement with something called a coordination race; which I want to include in order to easily activate your running muscles without pressure and stress somewhat differently than via distance and long-distance running. 

The coordination races are slightly faster running over 60-100 meters, where we run with good technique, work on speed in a gentle way. We will have the moment in the future, but usually in the warm-up before quality running. 

Try to be with the moment, without pressing or stressing and risking stretching. The rest between your coordinations is a leisurely walk back to the starting point. 

Today we introduce this with 3 x 80-100 meters. If you don't have a distance, take 5x20 seconds for simplicity's sake (without it being your speed). 

Run nice and high; see yourself as a nicely running elite runner....with an active front foot. 

NOTE; if it is very wintry and slippery, you wait to introduce the coordination races.

The program kicks off with a long pass straight away. However, today's session assumes that you had some running earlier in your autumn training and not just since the program started on Tuesday. If you feel that 17km is too far, shorten it to as far as feels good.

Calm, nice pace, preferably a little slower than your distance running. Guideline speed is 5.50-6.00 min per km, but you should therefore take your leisurely pace and then it just gives your time over 17km. Stretch easily after the session, and feel free to bring drinks with you to the session already now, even if the time out today does not require liquid.

If you bring the liquid with you now, you immediately establish a good routine that you have take advantage when the long passes get longer!

name: Training week 2
plan:
The training has started and we continue with 3 training sessions this week as well, but develop the training by adding a "general strength session" in connection with Tuesday's run.

Regarding the strength, it is a session that will return regularly every week. Running is a bit one-sided, and partly to improve our performance during running and partly to prevent wear and tear injuries, it is good to have a general strength session every week to "balance up" the body's muscle groups.

Do you have natural strength through something other own session in the week, you can count it "as your strength" and remove the program's strength.

Developing the training, we also do it on Thursday where the goal is for you to run a threshold session. Comfortable fast running, slightly faster than your distance; but don't push even though we divide 30 minutes into 10 interval parts. So NOT intervals, but just a few notches faster than your distance pace with regular rest. So an EASY pass :)

We add 1 km to the long pass, so the target there is 18 km at your leisurely pace. But shorten this if it feels too mastic for you in your start-up!

trainingDays.description:
The training has started and we continue with 3 training sessions this week as well, but develop the training by adding a "general strength session" in connection with Tuesday's run.

Regarding the strength, it is a session that will return regularly every week. Running is a bit one-sided, and partly to improve our performance during running and partly to prevent wear and tear injuries, it is good to have a general strength session every week to "balance up" the body's muscle groups.

Do you have natural strength through something other own session in the week, you can count it "as your strength" and remove the program's strength.

Developing the training, we also do it on Thursday where the goal is for you to run a threshold session. Comfortable fast running, slightly faster than your distance; but don't push even though we divide 30 minutes into 10 interval parts. So NOT intervals, but just a few notches faster than your distance pace with regular rest. So an EASY pass :)

We add 1 km to the long pass, so the target there is 18 km at your leisurely pace. But shorten this if it feels too mastic for you in your start-up!

6km at your leisurely distance speed, supplemented with strength training. If you have "your own strength training" in connection with another session in the week, you take it as your strength. But if you don't have a strength training session, I think it would be good if you could incorporate the strength of the program once a week. The goal of the strength is that it should help you get a good posture in your running and that it is injury-preventive in the long run. Here is a suggestion for a simple strength program that you can do at home. But of course you can compose your own strength. The focus will be on exercises for the torso (stomach/back).

The running strength exercises are described on the link "Running strength" End the strength session with a thorough stretch. It's good to have a "scheduled stretching session" at least once a week.

There is a long way to go before our final goal, so we won't run really tough sessions right now, but we will work from the start with something called threshold running.

"The threshold concept" means that you should run around the highest speed you can over the specified distance without accumulating fatigue substances in the muscles. (Often called lactic acid). A bit hard to describe, but if you're above it, it can only be a few notches faster than your distance running and the more you're used to the pace, the closer you can be to your limit and dare to push something more.

So try to find the position where you lie down for a while and get "just tired" like that. Then you will move your threshold a little bit with the help of the passport.

So at the beginning it is better to go a little too slowly than too fast. So comfortably tired!

Before you start the main part, you take a short calm distance warm-up and some mobility.

Then you are ready for the start and the goal today is to run 10 x 3 minutes threshold. A total of 30 minutes of threshold running. Take a 30 second rest with a light jog or walk between each section.

Please note that it is just THRESHOLD and not intervals, even though today we are breaking it up into so many shorter runs.

Do you want a target speed and don't just go by feel, a guideline can be around 5.20-5.25 min/km, so slightly faster than your intended marathon pace. That speed will give you around 550 meters per each 3-minute segment.

Rewind with a leisurely jog as the end of the session and briefly stretch the running muscles.

The progression in your long session has started, and we are increasing by 1 km compared to last week. As always, "guidelines", but you should start from your own calm speed. If you drove shorter last week, or feel that the start was too tough and you need a slightly softer start, shorten the long session slightly. Suitable to increase 1.5-2 km compared to last week, for those of you who drove shorter then.

If you haven't already got a hydration belt, now might be the time; so that you already take liquid with you on "our short" long passes. The liquid improves performance and stamina during the sessions, and helps your recovery to be faster along with a good intake of energy immediately after the session. However, water is enough during the session, but the longer it is, the more benefit you can, mentally and physically, have a little benefit from a weakly mixed sports drink.

Stretch out your running muscles easily after your long session!

name: Training week 3
plan: Christmas week, but the program and your training roll on. - As usual, we start with distance and strength and then it will be threshold Thursday where the threshold develops a little bit. On Christmas Eve there is a chance for the "best" (well, almost anyway) Christmas present with a nice slightly longer morning jog. Finally, the Christmas week is rounded off with a long session with step activation if your winter conditions and temperature allow. Overall; adapt the arrangement here to your particular Christmas week and your mood

trainingDays.description: Christmas week, but the program and your training roll on. - As usual, we start with distance and strength and then it will be threshold Thursday where the threshold develops a little bit. On Christmas Eve there is a chance for the "best" (well, almost anyway) Christmas present with a nice slightly longer morning jog. Finally, the Christmas week is rounded off with a long session with step activation if your winter conditions and temperature allow. Overall; adapt the arrangement here to your particular Christmas week and your moodâ€‹
Calm speed and a Round of 6 km followed by the strength of the program if you do not have your own strength in connection with another session in your Training week

Just like last week, the program has a threshold pass for you. If you didn't drive the pass last week and feel unsure about the layout, go back and check the text there. How the layout will be a little different today compared to last week. Just like then, however, you start with a short distance warm-up and some mobility. If you want, you can also run a light pulse-raising coordination run, but make sure that the warm-up is just a warm-up. The structure of the threshold training today will be threshold runs with a slightly longer running time than last time. Run 6 x 5 minutes, and take a slightly longer jog/walk rest than last time with 45 seconds rest now between each threshold section. A total of 30 minutes threshold time, and target speed if you want it even if your feeling is most important (comfortably tired!) will be like last week Around 5.20-5.25 min/km which gives you Around 5.5 km in total and a little over 900 meters per 5 minute episode. If you don't have a speed indication or you drive by feel 6 x 5 minutes at your comfortable fast speed with a 45 second rest. Relax with a gentle jog and a little stretching, and you have another good basic workout!

Voluntary Christmas gift with a morning jog starts Christmas Eve. It's a tradition here in the program. But don't feel pressure, if you don't get your passport, you're just done. ...and of course Merry Christmas from Coach Szalkaiâ€‹

Today a nice Christmas long run with the goal of reaching the same distance length as last week on the long run with the addition of a small speed element to change the step during your long run.

This of course assumes that you have ok winter surfaces to be able to increase the speed and that the weather in general allows for a slightly higher heart rate and breathing.

Ride calmly for around an hour, and then you add 5 x 1 minute speed increases with 1 minute rest between each speed section.

It is not an interval, but the idea is to you increase the speed in your 1 minute by around 15-20 seconds faster in kilometer speed than the base speed you have on the rest of the session.

In the calm minute you have between each speed increase, you take a slightly slower speed than you normally have as your base speed on the long pass.

After the speed section, you return to your base speed and complete today's 18 km distance.

In addition, you should remember to bring fluids with you during the long pass, even if it is winter. For "short long sessions" like this, water can be enough, but since we are going to drive a little faster, it can also feel good to get some energy via sports drink.

Also think about getting energy as soon as possible after the session so you speed up your recovery after the session. Grab a banana or maybe a recovery drink right after your workout.

name: Training week 4
plan:
New Year's week where we break off everything "long" with a few short foundation building intervals. Then usual threshold Thursday followed by a quiet voluntary New Year's jog.

(Are you running a New Year's race? yes, then you just remove the program's threshold pass and run your race instead)

On New Year's Day, the long pass continues and there we now start to be out for a really long time ; so make sure to be careful with energy and fluids in immediately after the workout and wear dry clothes. Then we fight all germs and optimize so that the recovery can start immediately!

(Ok remove the New Year's long pass if it doesn't work on your New Year's weekend!)â€‹

trainingDays.description:
New Year's week where we break off everything "long" with a few short foundation building intervals. Then usual threshold Thursday followed by a quiet voluntary New Year's jog.

(Are you running a New Year's race? yes, then you just remove the program's threshold pass and run your race instead)

On New Year's Day, the long pass continues and there we now start to be out for a really long time ; so make sure to be careful with energy and fluids in immediately after the workout and wear dry clothes. Then we fight all germs and optimize so that the recovery can start immediately!

(Ok remove the New Year's long pass if it doesn't work on your New Year's weekend!)â€‹

In the phase we are in the program now, you should not be fooled and intimidated by short intervals. It is and should be a session where you "just" should be reasonably tired. An "easy way" to work on your fitness and oxygen uptake at the same time that you will work a little with your faster muscle fibers. Warm up with light jogging, mobility and some coordination runs. Then our short interval, where we will have a really short rest to keep the speed from getting too high. We run 10 x 200 m or if you run on "clock" you take 10 x 50 seconds. The rest is standing for 30 seconds, which means that you should not run too fast, but only a few notches faster than your distance run. Find your rhythm and if you feel that it feels good, you can push a little more in the last 2-3 intervals if you feel like it, but overall a "just enough pass". Guideline, if you want it, can be a bit over 4.00 min/km in speed. Wind down with a leisurely jog and thoroughly stretch your muscles after you put in the week's running strength. So a great session today with many moments!

Today, the goal is to develop the threshold pass a notch for you who drive!

As before, you should find the speed between comfortable and uncomfortable fast, or if we start from talking pace, you should be able to say a sentence now and then, but not speak the whole the time...

We aim for 3 x 10 minute threshold, or if you start from distance it will be 3 x 1.8-1.9 km as the target speed is around 5.20-5.25 min/km.
\ nWe take a 60-second walk/light jog rest between the threshold sections. If you want/need to take a standing rest so that it feels comfortably tough, take a full standing rest.

But rather slow down the pace so you can walk/jog between each threshold section.

Then you will also keep the heat better :) Relax with calm jogging.

Do you have a New Year's run in your plan? Yes, then of course you remove today's threshold and replace it with the race on New Year's Eve!

You can remove the last session of the year with the program if you want to have a day without running. The body may not feel like running or they may be tight to get in a run today. So voluntary.... will be the last session of the year!â€‹

name: Training week 5
plan:
The first week of 2023 and of course we are training as before precisely so that the new year will be a really good running year!

No news really but you recognize yourself; continuity is the watchword and for continuity both calmer and tougher are important. So this week a calm start followed by good threshold and long pass again.

trainingDays.description:
The first week of 2023 and of course we are training as before precisely so that the new year will be a really good running year!

No news really but you recognize yourself; continuity is the watchword and for continuity both calmer and tougher are important. So this week a calm start followed by good threshold and long pass again.

We continue with threshold Thursday, and now develop the session a little more with an even longer continuous run. A total of 30 minutes again, but according to the model, the speed bits are 12-10-8 minutes or if you drive on a distance meter about 2 km1.85 km1.5 km. We take a 2-minute walk or a certain amount of calm jogging as a rest between each threshold section.

Start the first 12 minutes of the threshold soft, and then work on a little harder. Target picture that you maintain approximately 5.25 min/km on the 12 minute timer, 5.15-5.20 speed on the 10 minute threshold and then you can allow yourself to drop the threshold speed a little and faster than your threshold on the second half of the 8 minute, so maybe down to 5.05-5.10 min /km at the end of the 8-minute run.

The speeds assume that the winter is ok with you and if you start from effort, you make sure that the 12-minute run feels adequate (a little faster than distance running) and then you dare to get tired in the final 8-minute run .

Then unwind as usual with a leisurely jog and stretch.
Extra passes are offered. Remove if it feels like it might be too much for you or if you don't have the time.â€‹

Calm long pass where we approach the half-marathon limit! Bring drinks, and adjust your speed according to the surface and the feeling in your body. Calm should be calm just for you and just today. If you started with shorter long runs than what the program indicated, you can still run a few kilometers shorter even now.

name: Training week 6
plan: A good week in terms of quantity and quality. The speed consists of basic building 200 meter intervals on feel and on the Thursday session you will work a little longer in your intended marathon. Instead of running a long Round at our long-pass pace, we will accumulate long-pass volume through different threshold sections. The goal is for the session to give the volume we had on the long session last week, but now split up but in return at a higher speed. This is a long-pass variant that is in the setup of many elite runners, and which we are now testing here as well. The goal is that you will work on your oxygen uptake (fitness) in a gentle way, while you both physically and mentally train to hold on for a long time at a higher speed than long pass pace. Keep in mind that all sessions outside must be adapted to the winter that prevails in your area. Dare to adapt if necessary so that the load is not too hard!â€‹

trainingDays.description: A good week in terms of quantity and quality. The speed consists of basic building 200 meter intervals on feel and on the Thursday session you will work a little longer in your intended marathon. Instead of running a long Round at our long-pass pace, we will accumulate long-pass volume through different threshold sections. The goal is for the session to give the volume we had on the long session last week, but now split up but in return at a higher speed. This is a long-pass variant that is in the setup of many elite runners, and which we are now testing here as well. The goal is that you will work on your oxygen uptake (fitness) in a gentle way, while you both physically and mentally train to hold on for a long time at a higher speed than long pass pace. Keep in mind that all sessions outside must be adapted to the winter that prevails in your area. Dare to adapt if necessary so that the load is not too hard!â€‹

No traditional long session today, but the goal is to collect the volume you had on your long session last week via "threshold sections". Keep in mind that if the session FEELS TOO TOUGH, you can easily convert it into a "normal" long session at your leisurely base speed. But of course the coach hopes that it feels good and you want to try the set-up, which aims to push your fitness/threshold speed and your mental and physical strength to run a little faster even when we run long!

As the beginning and end of the session, you should run at your normal "calm" long-pass speed. Speed of speech is what matters, and the feeling should be calm. Both the beginning and the end create a bit of the day's "km volume".

Between the beginning and the end, the idea is that you should work on your marathon speed and your threshold speed divided into different kilometer sections with a quiet running rest (or walking rest) between each mara/threshold speed part . This will build up the volume of the session

Our volume goal with the entire session in total is today 20 km and both the introduction, the speed parts and the end can be a little flexible so you can adapt this to your Round. But you can see a suggested layout below, including target speeds that you of course adapt to possible winter conditions and cold weather.

If you don't have a watch that indicates speed, you go by feel where you should dare to "lay on" a little more during the speed parts than you normally have on your long run and feel a little more speed the shorter the speed part.

Introduction and finish at 6.00 pace, and the rest run between each speed part is around 6.10-6.20 pace.

Introduction approx. 5 km. (Ok stop and run a few minutes of effective mobility, after the distance introduction)

Speed parts 3 km - 2 km - 2 km - 1 km - 1 km - 1 km (total 10 km speed and approx. 2.5 km rest)
\ nBetween every 3-4 minutes of leisurely running. If the group/coaches want to run the exact length of the "rest", it will be a "jog" of 500 meters.

The finish will be around 2.5 km, assuming a running rest of about 500 meters between each speed section. At the end, the total distance can be adjusted so that you reach the 20 km distance goal.

The target speeds:

3 km â€“ 5.41 min/km (marathon speed)

2 km â€“ 5.33 min/km

1 km â€“ 5.23 min/ km where you get if you want to push a little extra on the last 1 km down to Around 5.11 min/km.

name: Training week 7
plan: The beginning of the week should be really calm, and the fartlek in particular is a good session to have in a week that should be calmer because your feeling and your body completely control how hard or how calm the session will be. But keep in mind that Monday to Saturday should be "recovery" but still maintain everything we built! Listen to your body, because programs unfortunately don't know how it feels to you. Keep in mind that a quiet week is now followed by tough training in the coming weeks!

trainingDays.description: The beginning of the week should be really calm, and the fartlek in particular is a good session to have in a week that should be calmer because your feeling and your body completely control how hard or how calm the session will be. But keep in mind that Monday to Saturday should be "recovery" but still maintain everything we built! Listen to your body, because programs unfortunately don't know how it feels to you. Keep in mind that a quiet week is now followed by tough training in the coming weeks!
Easy SHORT distance, supplemented with strength for you who follow the strength of the program.

21 calm km on the long pass today. Find your speed and remember that the time out on the pass is more important than chasing average speed. Find your rhythm and drink regularly throughout the session!

name: Training week 8
plan:
Good three-session week where our short intervals return so that you can work with a different step than at distance/threshold and so that you can work a little on your fitness development. 12 x 200 meters straight will be this week's speed session.

But before that we run distance and strength on Tuesday and then we work up the long session to a half marathon on Sunday!

So really long on Sunday, but at exactly your leisurely long session pace. Hope everything feels good and you are charged for a new step in your training.

trainingDays.description:
Good three-session week where our short intervals return so that you can work with a different step than at distance/threshold and so that you can work a little on your fitness development. 12 x 200 meters straight will be this week's speed session.

But before that we run distance and strength on Tuesday and then we work up the long session to a half marathon on Sunday!

So really long on Sunday, but at exactly your leisurely long session pace. Hope everything feels good and you are charged for a new step in your training.â€‹

Our short intervals will return; now with 5 more intervals than the last time we ran the session and no series rest but 12 x 200 meters straight. Warm up with light jogging, mobility and some coordination runs.

Then short intervals, where we run 12 x 200 m or if you run on a "clock" you take 12 x 50 seconds. The rest is standing/walking 40 seconds , which means that you can get up to speed and keep a good speed without pushing everything for the sake of it. Have a gear saved. It is and should be a session where you "just" should be reasonably tired. An "easy way" to work on your fitness and oxygen uptake at the same time that you will muscularly work a little with your faster muscle fibers.

Guided speed if you want it can be to lie in 4.10-4.15 min/km at speed. (Gives 50-51 seconds per 200 meters)

Relax with a leisurely jog and stretch the muscles thoroughly. The calves and backs of the thigh muscles are usually strained a little extra by the "overpass".

One step up...now we pass a half marathon with almost 1 km extra!!

22 km at your leisurely pace. Feel free to take short walks in connection with drinking; for drinks, you must bring them with you on the pass!

If you are not quite ready or the weather is not really long pass-friendly, of course it is perfectly fine to cut something short!

name: Training week 9
plan:
Tough week again! Hope everything feels good, because the idea is now that we will take the next step in the training ladder and get around 4 miles a week to be normal weeks, or at least almost normal weeks.

Progressive or increased distance and strength as the start of the week. Then on Thursday we lighten up the pace with an interval ladder. Then there will be speed elements and step change even in the long session if the winter permits.

trainingDays.description:
Warm-up and cool-down with 1km. Also do some mobility before the "start" of the main part, which will be continued distance running but at a progressively increasing speed if everything feels ok.

Start at a slightly faster pace than your calm distance pace and then gradually increase by feel so that during the the last two kilometers run "really fast".

A tough session, but you should only be tired at the end, so still gentle on the psyche. Go by feel, and the target image will be clear during your marathon speed over your 6km. (The program counts on 5.20 on average, with 5.40 first km and then down to 5.00/5.10 at the end)

Today we will run an interval step that first "goes up" and then turns around and "goes down again". Total 16 minute interval time. First, as usual, a good warm-up. Then when you are ready for the steps which involve 1-2-3-4-3-2-1 minute intervals with 1 minute walking/standing rest between each interval. The goal is to get some speed variation, so the shorter the interval, the faster the speed, and preferably also that the closing 3-2-1 minutes are faster than your opening 1-2-3. So go out easy and have nice harmony up to the 4 minute intervals; and then when it becomes shorter and shorter intervals you can go on again.

1 minutes; Around 4.20 min/km at speed

2 minutes Around 4.30-4.35 min/km at speed

3 minutes Around 4.45 min/km

4 minutes Around 4.50-5.00 min/km

Then a bit faster on the final 3-2-1 min than your initial corresponding interval distances calculated in time.

Please note that your feeling is more important than direction! Find your find on the pass.

Exhale and unwind with a few kilometers of leisurely running and a little stretch for your running muscles.
The extra session, for volume and good muscular effect in combination with tomorrow's long session. Take the opportunity to take a mobility element to preserve your mobility.

No increase in distance length today, but in return the goal is a long session with an increase in speed included - provided it works with your winter.

The idea is that today you add in 3 x 5 minutes of speed increases with 2 minutes of calm running between each speed section. Let the speed part come Around halfway into the session, but more important than "when the speed comes" is that the barrel element fits into your Round.

To get a good feel for this speed part, you can put in a 1 minute " switch the speed part" step before starting the 5 minute speed parts. Run the "minute" at your comfortably fast pace, and let it build up your leg speed/stride and heart rate.

Take 1-2 minutes of easy running after this "warm-up" speed portion, before then starting your 5 minutes speed splits.

The goal in speeding your "5 minutes" is to maintain your marathon average speed to reach the time goal or even slightly faster. So concretely, your target image can be 5.30-5.40 in minutes per kilometer.

We set 2 minutes as a calm pace between the speed parts, but this part can be a little flexible, so you can get to your 5 minute speed parts on a relatively flat stretch. The speed on the calmer part can be around 10-15 seconds slower in min/km than your normal long pass speed.

After the pace you take a few minutes really easy before you find your normal long pass speed and complete the pass so you reach the day's distance goal .

Don't forget to bring drinks to the session, and feel free to take something with energy before starting the speed part!

NOTE; should the winter not "allow" speed elements today, well then you drive a normal long session and skip the speed sections.

name: Training week 10
plan:
Real volume week with four training sessions for those who feel it works; with that, we can reach a magical 5 miles in total in one week!

The long session continues to increase, and now we are up to about a "half race" and we are still not even halfway into the program; so you're good for that!!

New in this week's training are Thursday's long intervals. Drive that pass by feel. If the weather, surface or your body is not 100%, you have to remember not to look too much at direction, but start from your feeling. A tough session, but you shouldn't be completely exhausted. The whole is more important than individual passes!

trainingDays.description:
Real volume week with four training sessions for those who feel it works; with that, we can reach a magical 5 miles in total in one week!

The long session continues to increase, and now we are up to about a "half race" and we are still not even halfway into the program; so you're good for that!!

New in this week's training are Thursday's long intervals. Drive that pass by feel. If the weather, surface or your body is not 100%, you have to remember not to look too much at direction, but start from your feeling. A tough session, but you shouldn't be completely exhausted. The whole is more important than individual passes!

Slightly longer distance sessions which, after a short warm-up, should be the marathon speed for the program's time goal. (or your time goal). Long session overall, but hopefully not a session where you are completely exhausted (because you shouldn't be) so you have the strength to supplement with strength, if you don't have your own strength.

Today, the idea is that we will run long intervals. We warm up as usual with calm distance speed, easy mobility and coordination runs before the start of the interval. You then run on relatively flat ground either a measured distance of 800 meters or the time indicated on the watch or based on the watch's distance meter. The goal is to have clearly higher speed than during your distance running, and it should be a relatively tough session. It's important that you don't run too fast in the first intervals, because then it will easily become an inharmonious session with lactic acid in the legs right from the start. Start in time, and aim for the last intervals to be your fastest. We aim to complete a full 6 intervals, if it feels too much, take one or two intervals less. Rest 1 minute stationary between each interval. So the passport in short; 6x800 meters or 6 x 3.45 with 1 minute rest. (guideline speed Around 4.45 min/km) We will increase the speed slightly on the intervals later in the program. Wind down with a leisurely run and then finish with a good stretch for the running muscles. The goal is to have clearly higher speed than during your distance running, and it should be a relatively tough session. It's important that you don't run too fast in the first intervals, because then it will easily become an inharmonious session with lactic acid in the legs right from the start. Start in time, and aim for the last intervals to be your fastest. We aim to complete a full 6 intervals, if it feels too much, take one or two intervals less. Rest 1 minute stationary between each interval. So the passport in short; 6x800 meters or 5x3.45 with 1 minute rest. (guideline speed Around 4.45 min/km) We will increase the speed slightly on the intervals later in the program. Wind down with a leisurely run and then finish with a good stretch for the running muscles.

Light extra distance for a little more volume in your volume week and to get a really good muscular training effect on the weekend session.

If 4 sessions a week are too much, this is the session you remove, the same if you are tired. Then you rest today and focus on a good 23 km session tomorrow.

We increase the long pass by 1 km. Take your leisurely pace, and walk or jog as you drink after about every 20 minutes. Stretch lightly after the session. If you are tired from the recent training, you can shorten it somewhat, but try to be out for at least 1 hour and 45 minutes and take a slightly slower pace instead.

name: Training week 11
plan: This week is meant to be a slightly easier week, but I don't really know if almost 4 miles is easier? Well now that's it!! So make sure that the first session of the week is really calm and adjust the threshold session according to how you feel in general and of course according to external circumstances. Sunday's long pass is what pulls up the week's volume, as the pass now stretches out to a full 24 km. If you fix it at a leisurely pace, I think you are well suited to the training plan for the Asics Stockholm Marathon! But if you are tired, shorten the threshold to 2 x 10 min or the long session to Around 2 miles.

trainingDays.description: This week is meant to be a slightly easier week, but I don't really know if almost 4 miles is easier? Well now that's it!! So make sure that the first session of the week is really calm and adjust the threshold session according to how you feel in general and of course according to external circumstances. Sunday's long pass is what pulls up the week's volume, as the pass now stretches out to a full 24 km. If you fix it at a leisurely pace, I think you are well suited to the training plan for the Asics Stockholm Marathon! But if you are tired, shorten the threshold to 2 x 10 min or the long session to Around 2 miles.

Easy distance running supplemented strength!

Strength with the same setup as last week for those of you who don't run your own strength.

30 minutes threshold running divided into 3x10 minutes with 1.5 minutes standing/light jogging rest. Target speed Around 5.25 min/km and then gives 10 minutes Around 1.8 km.

Find the speed where you are at or just below the speed where the body starts to accumulate lactic acid.

The idea is therefore that you should find a pace that you can hold without going completely out. As always, the feeling is more important than the direction, especially if the weather/surface is not favorable and since the week should be somewhat "calmer", it is also important that the session is not too hard for you in terms of speed and effort.

Really long today. Calm speed that you adapt to the surface and weather, so that it feels calm just for you. Ok to shorten 1-2 km without affecting "that you would fall behind". Take drinks with you on the session, and be careful with dry clothes and quick energy/fluid intake after you finish the session.

name: Training week 12
plan:
We pulse up again to a very considerable amount and good training!! Introduction with the "maradistan session" and then on Thursday we start your and the program's hill running with running training in the warm-up!!

If the winter surface does not allow hill running/running training, then you convert the session into some fartlek. If you run the hill on a treadmill (which is perfectly fine), you can add the running training to another session that you run outside. (Tuesday or Saturday, because it's difficult to do running training on a treadmill)

Hope you find the right one, and don't be "frightened" by the slope. You will get tired, but certainly not exhausted. The hill gives the best effect if you run just right in the early period we are in now!! If you do everything on that pass, it is easy to burn both the psyche and also physically. See the training as a big whole, and then no individual sessions must be too tough!

On Sunday, there will be an adjustment in the program with a brand new session that the coach calls marathon tweezers. The target image is that the session should provide long-distance volume, but that you collect the volume via 16 x 1 km at a slightly faster pace than your planned average speed on the marathon.

The goal of the session is that you will work on your oxygen uptake (fitness) in a gentle way at the same time that you are both physically and mentally training to hold on for a long time at a higher speed than a long session pace.

trainingDays.description:
